intents.description: Analyze NPS by region to understand regional satisfaction differences
Compare satisfaction across subscription plans to identify if enterprise customers are more satisfied than free/basic users
Analyze correlation between feature usage and overall satisfaction to identify features driving satisfaction
Segment customers by tenure and analyze NPS to understand satisfaction profiles of long-term vs new customers
Identify at-risk customers by analyzing low NPS and low purchase intent scores

rationale: The analysis plan aims to provide a comprehensive understanding of customer satisfaction and identify actionable insights for product improvement. By analyzing NPS, satisfaction levels, and feature usage across different customer segments, we can pinpoint areas of strength and weakness. This will help prioritize improvements in the product roadmap and enhance customer retention strategies.

suggested_segments.name: Promoters
suggested_segments.notes: Customers who are highly likely to recommend (NPS 9-10)

suggested_segments.name: Detractors
suggested_segments.notes: Customers who are unlikely to recommend (NPS 0-6)

suggested_segments.name: Free/Basic Customers
suggested_segments.notes: Customers on Free or Basic plans

suggested_segments.name: New Customers
suggested_segments.notes: Customers with tenure of less than 6 months

suggested_segments.name: Feature Users
suggested_segments.notes: Customers who have used any of the features

suggested_segments.name: Low Purchase Intent
suggested_segments.notes: Customers unlikely to purchase again (Purchase Intent 1-2)

suggested_segments.name: High Income Customers
suggested_segments.notes: Customers with high annual household income
